00040 #include <inttypes.h>

00054 #define dprintf(fmt, args...) //printf(fmt, ##args)
00055 #define error(fmt, args...) do {                        \
00056         fflush(stdout), fflush(stderr);                 \
00057         fprintf(stderr, "\nError:" fmt, ##args);        \
00058         abort();                                        \
00059 } while(0)
00060 
00061 #define ALIGN_SIZE       4096
00062 #define ALIGN_MASK       (~(ALIGN_SIZE - 1))
00063 
00064 static struct it_node {
00065         struct interval_node node;
00066         struct list_head list;
00067         int hit, valid;
00068 } *it_array;
00069 static int it_count;
00070 static struct list_head header = LIST_HEAD_INIT(header);
00071 static unsigned long max_count = ULONG_MAX & ALIGN_MASK;
00072 static int have_wide_lock = 0;
00073 
00074 static void it_test_clear(void)
00075 {
00076         int i = 0;
00077         for (i = 0; i < it_count; i++)
00078                 it_array[i].hit = 0;
00079 }
00080 
00081 static enum interval_iter cb(struct interval_node *n, void *args)
00082 {
00083         struct it_node *node = (struct it_node *)n;
00084         static int count = 1;
00085 
00086         if (node->hit == 1) {
00087                 error("A duplicate node [%#jx:%#jx] access found\n",
00088                       (uintmax_t)n->in_extent.start,
00089                       (uintmax_t)n->in_extent.end);
00090                 return INTERVAL_ITER_CONT;
00091         }
00092 
00093         if (node->valid == 0) {
00094                 error("A deleted node [%#jx:%#jx] being accessed\n",
00095                       (uintmax_t)n->in_extent.start,
00096                       (uintmax_t)n->in_extent.end);
00097                 return INTERVAL_ITER_STOP;
00098         }
00099 
00100         if (count++ == 8) {
00101                 dprintf("\n");
00102                 count = 1;
00103         }
00104         dprintf("[%#jx:%#jx] ", (uintmax_t)n->in_extent.start,
00105                 (uintmax_t)n->in_extent.end);
00106         fflush(stdout);
00107 
00108         node->hit = 1;
00109         return INTERVAL_ITER_CONT;
00110 }
00111 
00112 static int it_test_search(struct interval_node *root)
00113 {
00114         struct it_node *n;
00115         struct interval_node_extent ext;
00116         int times = 10, i, err = 0;
00117 
00118         while (times--) {
00119                 it_test_clear();
00120                 ext.start = (random() % max_count) & ALIGN_MASK;
00121                 ext.end = random() % (max_count - ext.start + 2) + ext.start;
00122                 ext.end &= ALIGN_MASK;
00123                 if (ext.end > max_count)
00124                         ext.end = max_count;
00125 
00126                 dprintf("\n\nSearching the node overlapped [%#jx:%#jx] ..\n",
00127                         (uintmax_t)ext.start, (uintmax_t)ext.end);
00128 
00129                 interval_search(root, &ext, cb, NULL);
00130 
00131                 dprintf("\nverifing ...");
00132 
00133                 /* verify */
00134                 for (i = 0; i < it_count; i++) {
00135                         n = &it_array[i];
00136                         if (n->valid == 0)
00137                                 continue;
00138 
00139                         if (extent_overlapped(&ext, &n->node.in_extent) &&
00140                             n->hit == 0)
00141                                 error("node [%#jx:%#jx] overlaps [%#jx:%#jx],"
00142                                       "but never to be hit.\n",
00143                                       (uintmax_t)n->node.in_extent.start,
00144                                       (uintmax_t)n->node.in_extent.end,
00145                                       (uintmax_t)ext.start, (uintmax_t)ext.end);
00146 
00147                         if (!extent_overlapped(&ext, &n->node.in_extent) &&
00148                             n->hit)
00149                                 error("node [%#jx:%#jx] overlaps [%#jx:%#jx], but hit.\n",
00150                                       (uintmax_t)n->node.in_extent.start,
00151                                       (uintmax_t)n->node.in_extent.end,
00152                                       (uintmax_t)ext.start, (uintmax_t)ext.end);
00153                 }
00154                 if (err) error("search error\n");
00155                 dprintf("ok.\n");
00156         }
00157 
00158         return 0;
00159 }
00160 
00161 static int it_test_iterate(struct interval_node *root)
00162 {
00163         int i;
00164 
00165         dprintf("\n\nIterate testing start..\n");
00166 
00167         it_test_clear();
00168         interval_iterate(root, cb, NULL);
00169 
00170         /* verify */
00171         for (i = 0; i < it_count; i++) {
00172                 if (it_array[i].valid == 0)
00173                         continue;
00174                 if (it_array[i].hit == 0) {
00175                         error("Node [%#jx:%#jx] is not accessed\n",
00176                               (uintmax_t)it_array[i].node.in_extent.start,
00177                               (uintmax_t)it_array[i].node.in_extent.end);
00178                 }
00179         }
00180         return 0;
00181 }
00182 
00183 static int it_test_iterate_reverse(struct interval_node *root)
00184 {
00185         int i;
00186 
00187         dprintf("\n\niterate reverse testing start..\n");
00188         it_test_clear();
00189         interval_iterate_reverse(root, cb, NULL);
00190 
00191         /* verify */
00192         for (i = 0; i < it_count; i++) {
00193                 if (it_array[i].valid == 0)
00194                         continue;
00195                 if (it_array[i].hit == 0)
00196                         error("Not every extent is accessed\n");
00197         }
00198 
00199         return 0;
00200 }
00201 
00202 static int it_test_find(struct interval_node *root)
00203 {
00204         int idx;
00205         struct interval_node_extent *ext;
00206 
00207         dprintf("\ninterval_find testing start ..\n");
00208         for (idx = 0; idx < it_count; idx++) {
00209                 if (it_array[idx].valid == 0)
00210                         continue;
00211 
00212                 ext = &it_array[idx].node.in_extent;
00213                 dprintf("Try to find [%#jx:%#jx]\n", (uintmax_t)ext->start,
00214                         (uintmax_t)ext->end);
00215                 if (!interval_find(root, ext)) {
00216                         error("interval_find, try to find [%#jx:%#jx]\n",
00217                               (uintmax_t)ext->start, (uintmax_t)ext->end);
00218                 }
00219         }
00220         return 0;
00221 }
00222 
00223 /* sanity test is tightly coupled with implementation, so when you changed
00224  * the interval tree implementation, change this code also. */
00225 static enum interval_iter sanity_cb(struct interval_node *node, void *args)
00226 {
00227         __u64 max_high = node->in_max_high;
00228         struct interval_node *tmp, *parent;
00229         int left = 1, has = 0, nr = 0;
00230 
00231         parent = node->in_parent;
00232         node->in_parent = NULL;
00233         interval_for_each(tmp, node) {
00234                 if ((left && node_compare(tmp, node) > 0) ||
00235                     (!left && node_compare(tmp, node) < 0))
00236                         error("interval tree sanity test\n");
00237 
00238                 if (tmp->in_max_high > max_high) {
00239                         dprintf("max high sanity check, max_high is %llu,"
00240                                 "child max_high: %llu[%#jx:%#jx]\n",
00241                                 max_high, tmp->in_max_high,
00242                                 __F(&tmp->in_extent));
00243                         goto err;
00244                 } else if (tmp->in_max_high == max_high) {
00245                         has = 1;
00246                 }
00247 
00248                 if (tmp == node) {
00249                         left = 0;
00250                         continue;
00251                 }
00252         }
00253 
00254         if (!has) {
00255                 int count;
00256 err:
00257                 count = 1;
00258                 dprintf("node[%#jx:%#jx]:%llu Child list:\n",
00259                         node->in_extent.start,
00260                         node->in_extent.end,
00261                         node->in_max_high);
00262 
00263                 interval_for_each(tmp, node) {
00264                         dprintf("[%#jx:%#jx]:%llu ",
00265                                 __F(&tmp->in_extent),
00266                                 tmp->in_max_high);
00267                         if (count++ == 8) {
00268                                 dprintf("\n");
00269                                 count = 1;
00270                         }
00271                 }
00272 
00273                 error("max high sanity check, has == %d\n", has);
00274         }
00275         node->in_parent = parent;
00276 
00277         tmp = node;
00278         while (tmp) {
00279                 if (node_is_black(tmp))
00280                         nr++;
00281                 else if ((tmp->in_left && node_is_red(tmp->in_left)) ||
00282                          (tmp->in_right && node_is_red(tmp->in_right)))
00283                         error("wrong tree, a red node has red child\n");
00284                 tmp = tmp->in_left;
00285         }
00286 
00287         tmp = node;
00288         while (tmp) {
00289                 if (node_is_black(tmp))
00290                         nr--;
00291                 tmp = tmp->in_right;
00292         }
00293         if (nr)
00294                 error("wrong tree, unbalanced!\n");
00295 
00296         return 0;
00297 }
00298 
00299 static int it_test_sanity(struct interval_node *root)
00300 {
00301         it_test_clear();
00302         interval_iterate(root, sanity_cb, NULL);
00303         return 0;
00304 }
00305 
00306 static int it_test_search_hole(struct interval_node *root)
00307 {
00308         int i, count = 10;
00309         struct interval_node_extent ext, ext2;
00310         struct it_node *n;
00311         __u64 low = 0, high = ~0;
00312 
00313         do {
00314                 if (--count == 0)
00315                         return 0;
00316 
00317                 ext.start = random() % max_count;
00318                 ext.end = ext.start;
00319         } while (interval_is_overlapped(root, &ext));
00320         ext2 = ext;
00321 
00322         interval_expand(root, &ext, NULL);
00323         dprintf("Extending [%#jx:%#jx] to ..[%#jx:%#jx]\n",
00324                 (uintmax_t)ext2.start, (uintmax_t)ext2.end,
00325                 (uintmax_t)ext.start, (uintmax_t)ext.end);
00326         for (i = 0; i < it_count; i++) {
00327                 n = &it_array[i];
00328                 if (n->valid == 0)
00329                         continue;
00330 
00331                 if (extent_overlapped(&ext, &n->node.in_extent)) {
00332                         error("Extending [%#jx:%#jx] to ..[%#jx:%#jx] overlaps node[%#jx:%#jx]\n",
00333                               (uintmax_t)ext2.start, (uintmax_t)ext2.end,
00334                               (uintmax_t)ext.start, (uintmax_t)ext.end,
00335                               (uintmax_t)n->node.in_extent.start,
00336                               (uintmax_t)n->node.in_extent.end);
00337                 }
00338 
00339                 if (n->node.in_extent.end < ext2.start)
00340                         low = max_u64(n->node.in_extent.end + 1, low);
00341 
00342                 if (n->node.in_extent.start > ext2.end)
00343                         high = min_u64(n->node.in_extent.start - 1, high);
00344         }
00345 
00346         /* only expanding high right now */
00347         if (ext2.start != ext.start || high != ext.end) {
00348                 ext2.start = low, ext2.end = high;
00349                 error("Real extending result:[%#jx:%#jx], expected:[%#jx:%#jx]\n",
00350                       (uintmax_t)ext.start, (uintmax_t)ext.end,
00351                       (uintmax_t)ext2.start, (uintmax_t)ext2.end);
00352         }
00353 
00354         return 0;
00355 }
00356 
00357 static int contended_count = 0;
00358 #define LOOP_COUNT 1000
00359 static enum interval_iter perf_cb(struct interval_node *n, void *args)
00360 {
00361         unsigned long count = LOOP_COUNT;
00362         while (count--);
00363         contended_count++;
00364         return INTERVAL_ITER_CONT;
00365 }
00366 
00367 static inline long tv_delta(struct timeval *s, struct timeval *e)
00368 {
00369         long c = e->tv_sec - s->tv_sec;
00370         c *= 1000;
00371         c += (long int)(e->tv_usec - s->tv_usec) / 1000;
00372         dprintf("\tStart: %lu:%lu -> End: %lu:%lu\n",
00373                 s->tv_sec, s->tv_usec, e->tv_sec, e->tv_usec);
00374         return c;
00375 }
00376 
00377 static int it_test_performance(struct interval_node *root, unsigned long len)
00378 {
00379         int i = 0, interval_time, list_time;
00380         struct interval_node_extent ext;
00381         struct it_node *n;
00382         struct timeval start, end;
00383         unsigned long count;
00384 
00385         ext.start = (random() % (max_count - len)) & ALIGN_MASK;
00386         ext.end = (ext.start + len) & ALIGN_MASK;
00387         if (have_wide_lock) {
00388                 ext.start = (max_count - len) & ALIGN_MASK;
00389                 ext.end = max_count;
00390         }
00391 
00392         dprintf("Extent search[%#jx:%#jx]\n", (uintmax_t)ext.start,
00393                 (uintmax_t)ext.end);
00394 
00395         /* list */
00396         contended_count = 0;
00397         gettimeofday(&start, NULL);
00398         list_for_each_entry(n, &header, list) {
00399                 if (extent_overlapped(&ext, &n->node.in_extent)) {
00400                         count = LOOP_COUNT;
00401                         while (count--);
00402                         contended_count++;
00403                 }
00404         }
00405         gettimeofday(&end, NULL);
00406         list_time = tv_delta(&start, &end);
00407         i = contended_count;
00408 
00409         /* interval */
00410         contended_count = 0;
00411         gettimeofday(&start, NULL);
00412         interval_search(root, &ext, perf_cb, &contended_count);
00413         gettimeofday(&end, NULL);
00414         interval_time = tv_delta(&start, &end);
00415 
00416         if (i != contended_count)
00417                 error("count of contended lock don't match(%d: %d)\n",
00418                       i, contended_count);
00419 
00420         printf("\tList vs Int. search: \n\t\t"
00421                "(%d vs %d)ms, %d contended lock.\n",
00422                 list_time, interval_time, contended_count);
00423 
00424         return 0;
00425 }
00426 
00427 static struct interval_node *it_test_helper(struct interval_node *root)
00428 {
00429         int idx, count = 0;
00430         struct it_node *n;
00431 
00432         count = random() % it_count;
00433         while (count--) {
00434                 idx = random() % it_count;
00435                 n = &it_array[idx];
00436                 if (n->valid) {
00437                         if (!interval_find(root, &n->node.in_extent))
00438                                 error("Cannot find an existent node\n");
00439                         dprintf("Erasing a node [%#jx:%#jx]\n",
00440                                 (uintmax_t)n->node.in_extent.start,
00441                                 (uintmax_t)n->node.in_extent.end);
00442                         interval_erase(&n->node, &root);
00443                         n->valid = 0;
00444                         list_del_init(&n->list);
00445                 } else {
00446                         __u64 low, high;
00447                         low = (random() % max_count) & ALIGN_MASK;
00448                         high = ((random() % max_count + 1) & ALIGN_MASK) + low;
00449                         if (high > max_count)
00450                                 high = max_count;
00451                         interval_set(&n->node, low, high);
00452                         while (interval_insert(&n->node, &root))
00453                                 interval_set(&n->node, low, ++high);
00454                         dprintf("Adding a node [%#jx:%#jx]\n",
00455                                 (uintmax_t)n->node.in_extent.start,
00456                                 (uintmax_t)n->node.in_extent.end);
00457                         n->valid = 1;
00458                         list_add(&n->list, &header);
00459                 }
00460         }
00461 
00462         return root;
00463 }
00464 
00465 static struct interval_node *it_test_init(int count)
00466 {
00467         int i;
00468         uint64_t high, low, len;
00469         struct it_node *n;
00470         struct interval_node *root = NULL;
00471 
00472         it_count = count;
00473         it_array = (struct it_node *)malloc(sizeof(struct it_node) * count);
00474         if (it_array == NULL)
00475                 error("it_array == NULL, no memory\n");
00476 
00477         have_wide_lock = 0;
00478         for (i = 0; i < count; i++) {
00479                 n = &it_array[i];
00480                 do {
00481                         low = (random() % max_count + 1) & ALIGN_MASK;
00482                         len = (random() % 256 + 1) * ALIGN_SIZE;
00483                         if (!have_wide_lock && !(random() % count)) {
00484                                 low = 0;
00485                                 len = max_count;
00486                                 have_wide_lock = 1;
00487                         }
00488                         high = low + (len & ALIGN_MASK);
00489 
00490                         interval_set(&n->node, low, high);
00491                 } while (interval_insert(&n->node, &root));
00492                 n->hit = 0;
00493                 n->valid = 1;
00494                 if (i == 0)
00495                         list_add_tail(&n->list, &header);
00496                 else
00497                         list_add_tail(&n->list, &it_array[rand()%i].list);
00498         }
00499 
00500         return root;
00501 }
00502 
00503 static void it_test_fini(void)
00504 {
00505         free(it_array);
00506         it_array = NULL;
00507         it_count = 0;
00508         max_count = 0;
00509 }
00510 
00511 int main(int argc, char *argv[])
00512 {
00513         int count = 5, perf = 0;
00514         struct interval_node *root;
00515         struct timeval tv;
00516 
00517         gettimeofday(&tv, NULL);
00518         srandom(tv.tv_usec);
00519 
00520         if (argc == 2) {
00521                 if (strcmp(argv[1], "-p"))
00522                         error("Unknow options, usage: %s [-p]\n", argv[0]);
00523                 perf = 1;
00524                 count = 1;
00525         }
00526 
00527         if (perf) {
00528                 int M = 1024 * 1024;
00529                 root = it_test_init(1000000);
00530                 printf("1M locks with 4K request size\n");
00531                 it_test_performance(root, 4096);
00532                 printf("1M locks with 128K request size\n");
00533                 it_test_performance(root, 128 * 1024);
00534                 printf("1M locks with 256K request size\n");
00535                 it_test_performance(root, 256 * 1024);
00536                 printf("1M locks with 1M request size\n");
00537                 it_test_performance(root, 1 * M);
00538                 printf("1M locks with 16M request size\n");
00539                 it_test_performance(root, 16 * M);
00540                 printf("1M locks with 32M request size\n");
00541                 it_test_performance(root, 32 * M);
00542                 printf("1M locks with 64M request size\n");
00543                 it_test_performance(root, 64 * M);
00544                 printf("1M locks with 128M request size\n");
00545                 it_test_performance(root, 128 * M);
00546                 printf("1M locks with 256M request size\n");
00547                 it_test_performance(root, 256 * M);
00548                 printf("1M locks with 512M request size\n");
00549                 it_test_performance(root, 512 * M);
00550                 printf("1M locks with 1G request size\n");
00551                 it_test_performance(root, 1024 * M);
00552                 printf("1M locks with 2G request size\n");
00553                 it_test_performance(root, 2048 * M);
00554                 printf("1M locks with 3G request size\n");
00555                 it_test_performance(root, 3072 * M);
00556                 printf("1M locks with 4G request size\n");
00557                 it_test_performance(root, max_count - 1);
00558                 it_test_fini();
00559                 return 0;
00560         }
00561 
00562         root = it_test_init(random() % 100000 + 1000);
00563         while (count--) {
00564                 it_test_sanity(root);
00565                 it_test_iterate(root);
00566                 it_test_iterate_reverse(root);
00567                 it_test_find(root);
00568                 it_test_search_hole(root);
00569                 it_test_search(root);
00570                 root = it_test_helper(root);
00571         }
00572         it_test_fini();
00573 
00574         return 0;
00575 }
